summary.title: Review Website Threat Model
summary.description:
A reviews website with three user roles (anonymous, identified, admin). 
Web server handles review posting/deletion, notifications sent via email server, 
authentication via identity management system, reviews stored in RDBMS, 
and logs written to a log server. Admin also manages configuration file. 
STRIDE methodology applied.

data.name:
Anonymous User
(Browser)
data.description: Unregistered visitor. Can read reviews only.

threats.title: Anonymous user identity spoofing
threats.description: Attacker forges/abuses anonymous sessions to scrape or abuse rate limits.
threats.mitigation: Global rate limiting, bot protection/CAPTCHA, IP reputation, consistent 401/403 handling.

threats.title: Action repudiation by anonymous users
threats.description: Anonymous actions cannot be tied to a person; abuse may be denied.
threats.mitigation: Structured logging with request IDs, timestamps, and evidence preservation; WORM/audit retention.

data.name:
Identified User
(Browser)
data.description: Authenticated visitor. Can read, post, and delete own reviews.

threats.title: Credential Stuffing Attack
threats.description: Attacker uses leaked passwords to log in as a user.
threats.mitigation: MFA, breached-password checks, rate limiting/lockout, IP throttling.

threats.title: User denies posting a review
threats.description: Authenticated user claims they didn’t perform an action.
threats.mitigation: Signed audit logs with user ID, timestamp, client info; immutable retention.

data.name:
Administrator 
(Browser/SSH)
data.description: Privileged user. Can manage reviews, configuration, and logs.

threats.title: Admin Account Takeover
threats.description: Attacker could gain access to the admin account via credential theft or brute force.
threats.mitigation: Strong MFA, rate limiting, IP restrictions, session timeout.

threats.title: Admin action repudiation
threats.description: Admin denies deleting or modifying reviews/log settings.
threats.mitigation: Append-only signed audit logs, dual-control for destructive ops, change tickets linked.

data.name:
Web Server/
API
data.description: Handles all user requests, interfaces with DB, logs, IdP, and email server.

threats.title: Stored XSS via Reviews
threats.description: Malicious review content executes in readers’ browsers.
threats.mitigation: Output encoding, safe Markdown/HTML sanitizer, CSP (no inline), input length/type checks.

threats.title: CSRF on delete/edit review
threats.description: Cross-site request causes state change.
threats.mitigation: CSRF tokens, SameSite cookies, POST-only for mutating ops, confirm dialogs.

threats.title: Unauthorized admin endpoints
threats.description: Weak/forgotten authZ lets normal users call admin APIs.
threats.mitigation: Central RBAC/policy layer, deny-by-default, explicit role checks, separate admin path + MFA.

threats.title: DoS via request flooding
threats.description: Excessive requests exhaust CPU/threads.
threats.mitigation: Rate limits, request time/size limits, autoscale, cache/pagination, WAF.

threats.title: Insecure deserialization/over-posting
threats.description: Model binding accepts fields that change server state or role.
threats.mitigation: DTO allowlists, disable polymorphic binding, server-side schema validation.

threats.title: Token replay / bad OIDC validation
threats.description: Missing nonce/state/aud checks allow replay or misuse.
threats.mitigation: Validate iss/aud/exp/nbf, enforce nonce/state, PKCE, short-lived tokens, clock skew limits.

threats.title: Weak session/logout controls
threats.description: Long idle sessions enable lateral use of stolen tokens.
threats.mitigation: Idle/absolute timeouts, back-channel logout, device/session list & revocation

threats.title: Email header/content injection
threats.description: Unsanitized fields break headers or inject links.
threats.mitigation: Templating with escaping, provider SDKs, validate subject/body inputs.

threats.title: User/review enumeration via emails
threats.description: Observable differences reveal existence of accounts/reviews.
threats.mitigation: Uniform responses/timing, generic messages, throttle email sends.

threats.title: Privilege escalation through hidden admin features
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Server-side RBAC checks on every action; no client-side trust.

threats.title: Clickjacking
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: X-Frame-Options/SAMEORIGIN, frame-ancestors CSP.

threats.title: SQL injection on review CRUD
threats.description: Malicious input modifies queries.
threats.mitigation: Parameterized queries, ORM safe APIs, least-priv DB user, input validation.

threats.title: Missing row-level authorization
threats.description: Users can read/delete others’ reviews.
threats.mitigation: Enforce ownership checks on server; add DB constraints; test coverage.

threats.title: Data exfiltration from excessive fields
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Response field allowlists, data minimization, views limited to needed columns.

threats.title: Sensitive logs exposed to normal users
threats.description: Private audit data accessible to any authenticated user.
threats.mitigation: Separate admin-only index, RBAC, redaction (no secrets/PII/tokens), least-priv read roles.

threats.title: Log forgery / tampering
threats.description: Crafted entries confuse audit trails; integrity lost.
threats.mitigation: Structured JSON logs, hashing/signing, append-only/WORM retention, time sync.

threats.title: Log ingestion overload
threats.description: Excess events cause loss/back-pressure on app.
threats.mitigation: Back-pressure handling, quotas, batching, async shipping with circuit breakers.

data.name:
Configuration
File (WS local)
data.description: Local config controlling system options, sensitive to tampering

threats.title: Config file tampering
threats.description: Local file edited to weaken security.
threats.mitigation: Strict file ACLs (read-only to service), signed config, change approvals.

threats.title: Secrets stored in plaintext
threats.description: DB/API keys in config are leaked.
threats.mitigation: Secret manager/KMS, do not store secrets in files; rotate keys.

threats.title: Invalid hot-reload causes failure
threats.description: Bad config reload crashes the app.
threats.mitigation: Schema validation, safe defaults, fail-closed, canary reload.
